text.title: CLIMATE AND CIVILIZATION
text.body: The Younger Dryas cold period ended 11,700 years ago. After this, Greenland warmed quickly, by about 7°C (12.6°F) in 50 years. Weather patterns shifted and sea levels rose rapidly. Human civilization emerged a relatively short time after climate stabilized.
